quotes.quote: Thunder is good, thunder is impressive; but it is lightning that does all the work.
Lightning strikes the earth and thunder heralds the doom but the earth bears it all in silence, teaching us that life may be harsh to us but we shouldn't be so to life.
They say marriages are made in Heaven. But so is thunder and lightning.
When you've been struck by lightning as many times as I have, you start to expect the worst pretty much all the time.
Lightning, your presence from ground to sky, no one knows what becomes of me, when you take me so quickly.

There is a lightning quickness to the speed at which candidates can build and accidentally dismantle their own campaigns. If candidates don't figure out their place in the new digital world of politics, they will be destroyed by it.
God only exhibits his thunder and lightning at intervals, and so they always command attention.
Sometimes you don't need lightning to start a fire. Sometimes, it builds on its own.
If lightning is the anger of the gods, then the gods are concerned mostly about trees.
It is not the roaring thunder that smites, but the silent lightning.
Thunder is good, thunder is impressive; but it is lightning that does the work.
They say that lightning never strikes in the same place twice, but the same is not true for courage. As it turns out, when courage strikes, it almost always begets more courage.
Lightning rendeth the rocks.
The more brilliant the lightning, the quicker it disappears.
Electricity is really just organized lightning.
Lightning doesn't strike through a cave.
Lightning is something which, again, we would rather avoid.
The best lightning rod for your protection is your own spine.
Lightning came like a rip in the inky night, as if behind the dark canvass was a brilliant light just waiting to flood through any crack no matter how small.
No mortal eye has ever fully seen a flash of lightning, for no matter how firmly we look, our eyes are sure to be dazzled.
The reason lightning doesn't strike twice in the same place is that the same place isn't there the second time.
When his flame falls, my lightning rises, and so on.
The lightning is in God's hands, and it strikes just where He bids it.
Lightning is the shorthand of a storm, and tells of chaos.
The cloud of mind is discharging its collected lightning.
And when I breathed, my breath was lightning.
The affections are like lightning: you cannot tell where they will strike till they have fallen.
If there were no thunder, men would have little fear of lightning.
Lightning hides the colour of night.
Lightning makes no sound until it strikes.
